Title: 100M - PHASED HEALTH LED REDEVELOPMENT PLAN
Site2: and RUAS site south of Upper Lisburn Road/Balmoral Avenue west of Harberton Park

Antrim has completed Phase 1 of this  project  The first phase saw the construction of  Dataworks  a new precision medicine hub/office  designed to attract data-focused medical  companies  with London Stock Exchange listed  Diaceutics having already signed up as a tenant  for the 10 000 sq.ft of space. Further phases of  the 100 million redevelopment plan will also  include community and leisure facilities  hotel  and restaurants.  Private developers  Benmore  Healthcare  are behind the project.  However  it  will offer both public and private facilities all  on one site.As elsewhere in Northern Ireland  GPs  will be able to rent space  while local health  trusts could also lease space to provide services  including diagnostics.  Catering for all age  groups  there could also be creche facilities and  residential care for older people.An outline  planning application which was submitted to  Belfast on 17/02/2020 by Benmore Octopus for this  redevelopment project has been recommended for  approval.These new plans outline for retirement  living at Plot 6  medical or health services at  Plot 9  a multi-storey car park  local retail  uses  restaurant and caf uses  leisure and gym  facilities at Plot 8  associated internal access  roads  new public realm and amenity open space   including central plaza and access from Upper  Lisburn Road (as per planning approval reference  LA04/2018/0040/F); and no matters reserved for  residential development (81 apartments) at Plot 3  with ground floor local retail use/restaurant and  caf uses/leisure and gym facilities  associated  landscaping  car parking and access from Upper  Lisburn Road (as per planning approval reference  LA04/2018/0040/F) and reconfiguration of  temporary car park to the rear of Kings Hall  (approved under LA04/2018/0040/F).The original  planning application (LA04/2018/0040/F) reads:   Demolition of 29 Balmoral Avenue  demolition of  existing non-li9 950 sq.m

Title: 48M - APARTMENT DEVELOPMENT
Site1: Lands adjacent to and south east of the River Lagan
Site2: north of Abercorn Crescent/Queens Road Queens Island
Scheme: 21st April 2021:  Following a pre planning  application discussion (PAD)  a pre planning  application notice (PAN) has now been served to  Belfast City Council regarding a site in Belfasts  Titanic Quarter.  Lacuna Developments  Watkin  Jones Group Plc  Titanic Quarter Limited and  Belfast Harbour Commissioners are working in  partnership to deliver the project which could  see 800 apartments built to include 20%  affordable and social housing.The notice outlines  the proposed construction of a mixed tenure  residential-led development comprising up to 800  units (private rented  social and affordable /  including studios  1  2  and 3 bed units) across  3 blocks.  Also the provision of active ground  and first floor uses; public realm including  public square and promenade; cycle and car  parking provision and associated access and site  works.An online consultation website will go live  week commencing 24th May 2021.  Webinars will be  held via Zoom on 1st June 2021 6pm-7pm and 3rd  June 2021 6pm-7pm.  The website address has yet  to be confirmed.A statement by the developers  described the project as an exciting proposal for  a new sustainable and shared residential  neighbourhood development in Belfasts Titanic  Quarter.The statement added The proposed scheme  will accommodate approximately 800 new apartment  homes. It will create the first mixed tenure  neighbourhood in this area of the city  bringing  together private accommodation  from studios up  to three-bedroom apartment homes  alongside high  quality social and affordable apartment homes   which represent 20% of the development.  The  ground floor active uses will include workspace   shops  cafes and restaurants  a gym  a pharmacy  and crche with opportunities for the community   arts and cultural sectors.  The plans also  include over an acre of public realm in the form  of a public square and park  along with a public  riverside promenade. Title: 20M - CORK CITY WATER SUPPLY SCHEME NETWORKS UPGRADES
Scheme: 21st April 2021: Main contractors Farrans  Construction Limited  Co. Antrim have commenced  site investigation works for the Cork City Water  Supply Scheme Networks Upgrades. Main works are  expected to commence in the coming months on the  development of the scheme. Irish Water is  responsible for the treatment and distribution of  drinking water in Cork City.As part of the  implementation of a Water Conservation Project  for the city  watermains in the network have been  identified for rehabilitation. These include  watermains that:Are not suitably responsive to  active leakage control measures;Have water  quality issues;Have reached the end of their  service life; and Have insufficient hydraulic  capacity and are impacting on the efficient  operation of the existing network. New sections  of water mains have also been identified which  will link existing strategic water supplies and  provide security of supply to Cork City.

Title: 27.5M - LANDFILL REMEDIATION PROJECT
Scheme: 22nd April 2021: Works are underway on the  remediation of Kerdiffstown Landfill Site to  include the construction of two administrative  buildings - Office and Leachate Management  Building and the latter addition of a  prefabricated conference room unit. Office  Building is a single storey building consisting  of 2 No. offices  a kitchen  lobby and bathroom  facilities. The Leachate Management Building is a  double volume building with an internal single  storey element consisting of a laboratory and  Mechanical Control Room with a precast concrete  slab roof. The double volume element is taken up  by a Plant Room.25th November 2020: Main  contractors  Wills Bros  Co. Mayo have commenced  works on the Kerdiffstown Landfill Remediation  Project.Remediation of the former landfill site  at Kerdiffstown  Naas  Co. Kildare by capping  wastes across the site  by providing a landscaped  profile to the site and improving the landfill  infrastructure systems  to ultimately provide a  multi-use public park. The site occupies  approximately 30 hectare and the works include  the following;Installation of an engineered  capping system across the site; Installation of  new environmental management and control systems  including leachate and landfill gas. This  includes gas and leachate collection treatment  and disposal systems and all associated  mechanical electrical instrumentation  control  and automation;Installation of a leachate  transfer leachate pipeline from the site   crossing under the N7 and Morell River and  connecting to Johnstown Pumping Station and then  onward to Osberstown Wastewater Treatment Plant  (WWTP);Development of a public park with  multi-use sports pitches  car parking  changing  room building  childrens playground and a network  of paths across the site including provision of  services and foul drainage to the public sewer  network.Works are expected to take in the region  of 48 months to complete.
Program: Start 23/11/2020.Completion 23/11/2024.Length of works 48 months.

Title: 9.1M - LIMERICK URBAN CENTRE REVITALISATION
Scheme: 20th April 2021: Contractors Shareridge  Co. Mayo  have commenced works on the construction of this  scheme. Previous survey works have been completed  in Q1 2021. The redistribution of space on  OConnell Street from Denmark Street to Cecil  Street  between various modes of transport and  the public realm. There are currently two  southbound traffic lanes on OConnell Street  between Denmark Street and Cecil Street. Kerbside  activities are provided for along both sides of  the street  including parking  disabled parking   taxi ranks  loading bays and bus stops. General  parking occupies the majority of this space along  the full length of the street. The project will  reduce the width of traffic lanes between Denmark  Street and Cecil Street to a maximum of 3.0m and  convert one lane to a bus lane between William  Street and Cecil Street. Parking and other  kerbside vehicular uses will be relocated. This  space will be adapted to provide wider footpaths   a northbound and southbound cycle lane  and  additional public realm areas to include street  furniture such as seating areas  trees  planting   bicycle stands  lighting  and water  installations  all of which will contribute to  the sense of place and make OConnell Street a  destination in and of itself as well as a  transport link in the city centre.
Program: Start 19/03/2021.Completion 26/03/2022.Length of works 12 months.

Title: A428 BLACK CAT TO CAXTON GIBBET
Site1: A428 Black Cat to Caxton Gibbet
Status: The scheme is being funded by the government's #15bn Road Investment Strategy.As of 24.03.2021 the Planning Inspectorate have formally accepted planning proposals and are not at pre-examination stage.
Scheme: A428 Black Cat to Caxton Gibbet. A new 10 mile dual carriageway between the Black Cat and Caxton Gibbet junctions  a three tier junction at the Black Cat roundabout will allow traffic to flow freely on the A1  A421 and the new road  new junctions at Cambridge Road and Caxton Gibbet will connect the new dual carriageway to the existing A428  the existing A428 will be retained for local traffic and public transport  close alignment to the existing A428 will help reduce environmental impacts  new bridges will cross over the dual carriageway at Roxton Road  Barford Road  the B1046 and Toseland Road  new bridges over the River Great Ouse and East Coast Main Line railway  improvements to A428/B1040 Eltisley junction  improved routes for cyclists  walkers and horse riders and safer and alternative access for some side roads.
Details: Roads:Surfaces:road surfacing;associated Road Works:accommodation Works road drainage gulley road lighting signage markings footpaths kerbing traffic management;
Program: Start July 2022.Completion July 2025.Length of works 36 months.
